ICYMI: My opening statement from today's IT Subcommittee hearing. Our existence as a #democracy depends on free, fair & accurate elections.pic.twitter.com/QtdyTId6qe
"Electronic voting systems must resist not only fraud from corrupt candidates & supporters, but also election disruption from hostile nation-state adversaries." - @mattblaze
"The integrity of the vote today depends on the integrity of the software systems - running on voting machines & on county election networks - over which elections are conducted" - @mattblaze
"We are not naïve about the likelihood of future #cyberattacks against digital elements of election systems, but we also know #paperballots include vulnerabilities" - @Louisiana_sos
Our adversaries have always sought to use our nation's unique qualities to undermine our democracy. Our voting systems are no exception.
Voting is one of our fundamental democratic rights & is the cornerstone of American democracy.

No one wants to hear about another hack, especially one that undermines our #democracy. Tune in at 2pm EST to see my IT Subcommittee explore the current state of #cybersecurity of our #voting machines.https://oversight.house.gov/hearing/cybersecurity-voting-machines/ …

Like anything else in digital age, electronic voting is vulnerable to #hacking. Tmrw I'll examine #cybersecurity of voting machines. Info: https://oversight.house.gov/hearing/cybersecurity-voting-machines/ …
